publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1269# Ms Margo MacDonald: Safety on the Rail Network—That the Parliament resolves that, failing a favourable decision by Her Majesty's Government to turn its investment in rail infrastructure into an effective shareholding in Railtrack, the Scottish Executive should investigate how safety standards can be raised and maintained in Scotland’s rail network.
S1M-1269# Safety on the Rail Network (lodged on 23 October 2000) Robin Harper*, Colin Campbell*, Shona Robison*
S1M-1269# Safety on the Rail Network (lodged on 23 October 2000) Brian Adam*, Margaret Smith*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-1269# Ms Margo MacDonald: Safety on the Rail Network—That the Parliament resolves that, failing a favourable decision by Her Majesty's Government to turn its investment in rail infrastructure into an effective shareholding in Railtrack, the Scottish Executive should investigate how safety standards can be raised and maintained in Scotland’s rail network. Supported by: Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Colin Campbell, Shona Robison, Brian Adam, Margaret Smith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Donald Gorrie
S1M-1269# Safety on the Rail Network (lodged on 23 October 2000) Christine Grahame*
S1M-1269# Safety on the Rail Network (lodged on 23 October 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Fiona McLeod*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1269# Safety on the Rail Network (lodged on 23 October 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1269# Ms Margo MacDonald: Safety on the Rail Network—That the Parliament resolves that, failing a favourable decision by Her Majesty's Government to turn its investment in rail infrastructure into an effective shareholding in Railtrack, the Scottish Executive should investigate how safety standards can be raised and maintained in Scotland’s rail network. Supported by: Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Colin Campbell, Shona Robison, Brian Adam, Margaret Smith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Andrew Wilson, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White
S1M-1269# Safety on the Rail Network (lodged on 23 October 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-1269# Ms Margo MacDonald: Safety on the Rail Network-That the Parliament resolves that, failing a favourable decision by Her Majesty's Government to turn its investment in rail infrastructure into an effective shareholding in Railtrack, the Scottish Executive should investigate how safety standards can be raised and maintained in Scotland's rail network. Supported by: Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Colin Campbell, Shona Robison, Brian Adam, Margaret Smith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Andrew Wilson, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram
S1M-1269# Safety on the Rail Network (lodged on 23 October 2000) Fergus Ewing*

S1M-1269# Ms Margo MacDonald: Safety on the Rail Network-That the Parliament resolves that, failing a favourable decision by Her Majesty's Government to turn its investment in rail infrastructure into an effective shareholding in Railtrack, the Scottish Executive should investigate how safety standards can be raised and maintained in Scotland's rail network. Supported by: Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Colin Campbell, Shona Robison, Brian Adam, Margaret Smith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Andrew Wilson, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Fergus Ewing
